did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Cornell University songs and sheet music, 1874-2000.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Cornell song books and sheet music.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Cornell song books. Booklets, and sheet music and other music and lyric sheets. A number of the songs are written by Cornell alumni and were performed by the Cornell Glee Club. Some of the items contain history or other information about the songs and their composers. Some tunes are Ithaca or locally related and others are not Cornell related, but standard college and university items. Includes, but not limited to: "Big Red Team," by Romeyn Berry, 1905, with picture of football team; "Carnelian and White," by K. L. Roberts and T. J. Lindorff, 1906; "Fight for Cornell," by K. L. Roberts and T. J. Lindorff, 1907; "We March to Victory," by G. F. Pond, 1908; "Cornell Victorious," by S. H. Ayer, 1915, with picture of Touchdown, the bear mascot; "My Old Cornell," by Will A. Dillon, n.d; Cornell drinking, Glee Club and sporting event songs, and others. Also some band music and musical program from the opening of Sage Chapel, June 13, 1875; Banquet Songs of XCI (Class of 1891?), February 15, 1889. There are multiple copies of some items.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.subject: Music -- New York (State) -- Ithaca -- Societies, etc.
Choral societies -- New York (State) -- Ithaca.
Students' songs -- United States.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Cornell University Songs and Sheet Music, #47-6-2124. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: RELATED MATERIALS
relatedmaterial.p: See also the Cornell University Glee Club Records, #37-6-2399, http://resolver.library.cornell.edu/cgi-bin/EADresolver?id=RMA02399.

emph.ref: Series IV. Miscellaneous Lyric Sheets and Music Related Items

scopecontent.p:
Lyrics and music by Albert W. Smith '78 and George F. Pond '10.
Handwritten copy by Pond.
Includes Give My Regards to Broadway, Varsity Drag, The Sweetheart of Sigma Chi, Whiffenpoof Song
Not a Cornell song, no composer given. Blue copy music is marked L. M. N..
Lyrics by Francis M. Finch. Music by W. O. Fiske.

Composed by Edward Bausch '74.
Complements of the composer.
Lyrics by John De Witt Warner '72. Music by Archibald C. Weeks '72.

Composed by George O. Wagner, possibly George Olds Wagner '00.
Dedicated to the Cornell University. Also includes a number of other non Cornell tunes from the Queen City Music Publishing Company.

Lyrics by Edward A. McCreary '00. Music by Edwin Haviland, Jr. '99 Grad.
Dedicated to the Cornell Navy.

Composed by Frederick B. Downing '94.
Also includes the Rough Riders March, 1898

Lyrics by Henry Pelouze de Forest '84. Music is the British Grenadiers.
Dedicated to the Class of '84 on their vigintennial, June 22, 1904.

Lyrics by Romeyn Berry '04. Music by Charles E. Tourison '06
One copy from the Frank Arthur Barton papers, one copy with the football players on the cover identified.

did.unittitle: Cornell University Medley: March & Two Step

scopecontent.p:
Composed by H. A. Lyon, possibly Henry Adelbert Lyon Law '97.
Dedicated to Jacob Gould Schurman.

Lyrics by Kenneth L. Roberts '08. Music by Theodore J. Lindorff '07
One copy from the Frank Arthur Barton papers.

Lyrics by Archibald C. Weeks '72. Music is the Air, Marching Through Georgia.
Dedicated to the Pioneer Classes of Cornell University.
Composed by William Luton Wood
Lyrics by Kenneth L. Roberts '08. Music by Theodore J. Lindorff '07

Composed by William Haywood Wright.
Signed by the composer to Captain Barton. From the Frank Arthur Barton papers.
Lyrics and music by George F. Pond '10
Lyrics by Thomas Riggs Cox '11. Music by Harold Franklin Welch '10

Composed by William Haywood Wright.
Dedicated to Mr. Charles E. Courtney.

Lyrics by James O. Winslow '11. Music by Edward F. Johnston.
Waltzes. Dedicated to Harold MacDowell Brown.

Composed by J. Franklin Bradley '11.
Inscribed by the composer to E.A. Richmond.

Lyrics by Henry Pelouze de Forest '84. Music by Jack Judge and Harry Williams.
Dedicated to the Senior Class December 29, 1914.

Composed by F. Frayser Hinton and Donald Stonebraker.
Dedicated to the Cornell University Glee Club. Also includes Don't Let Me Sleep 'till My Dreams Come True by W. C. R. Hart and Wheatly Davis.

Lyrics and music by S. Hibbard Ayer Jr. '14
Has a photo of Touchdown the bear on the cover.
Includes '88 Class Song, lyrics by Albert E. Hoyt '88. Music by Charles W. Curtis '88 and Cheer for the Team, composed by Charles W. Curtis '88.

Lyrics by Harvey Worthington Loomis. Music by Arthur Edward Johnstone.
Inspired by President Wilson's War address to Congress April 2, 1917.
Composed by Archibald C. Weeks '72

Composed by Will A. Dillon.
Dedicated to The Boys on the Hill.

Cover features what appears to be Roberts and Stone Halls.
Includes: Alma Mater, Cornell, The Song Of The Classes, Evening Song At Cornell, The Chimes, The Call Of The Fields, Bustonian Chorus, There's A Wedding In The Orchard, In The Gloaming, The Old Farm At Cornell, Last Night, I Arise From Dreams Of Thee, Drink To Me Only With Thine Eyes, Juanita, The Quilting Party, Jingle, BElls, When First I Kissed Sweet Margaret, Sweet And Low, Annie Laurie, Here's To The Girl That I Love, Forsaken, The Loreley, Flow Gently, Sweet Afton, Jolly Boating Weather, Sailing, Soldier's Farewell, Nancy Lee, Old Black Joe, Old Folks At Home, My Bonnie, Down In Mobile, Nelly Was A Lady, The Two Roses, Darling Nelly Gray, How Can I Leave Thee!, Hard Times Come Again No More, Landlord, Fill The Flowing Bowl, Upidee, The Man Who Has Plenty Of Good Peanuts, Solomon Levi, The Pope, The Old Oaken Bucket, Home Again, Home, Sweet Home, Lead, Kindly Night, Rocked In The Cradle Of The Deep, The Star-Spangled Banner, Stars Of The Summer Night, The Red, White, And Blue, America, Battle Hymn Of The Republic, John Brown's Body, Maryland! My Maryland!, Dixie's Land, We're Tenting To-Night, The Watch On The Rhine, The Marseillaise, Round The Old Camp Fire, Old Nassau, Sans Souci, Our College Cheer, Auld Lang Syne, Good-Night, Ladies!.

Presented by the Sphinx Head Senior Honorary Society. Also includes a bit of history about each song. Includes Alma Mater by Archibald Croswell Weeks '72 and Wilmot Moses Smith '74. The words of the Cornell Alma Mater were written early in 1872, through mutual suggestion, by Weeks and Smith, who then occupied rooms in the old Woodruff block on Tioga Street.
Cornell Victorious by S. Hibbard Ayer Jr. '14.
Cornell, lyrics by George Kingsley Birge '72 to the tune 'Twas My Last Cigar. First published in the Cornell Era spring 1869.
Song of the Classes by Frank A. Abbott '90.
Give My Regards to Davy to the tune of Give My Regards to Broadway.
Crew Song, lyrics by Robert James Kellog '91 and music by William Luton Wood. First published in the 1892 Cornellian.
Alumni Song, lyrics by Louis Carl Ehle '90, music by Wiliam Luton Wood. First published in the 1893 Cornellian.
Evening Song, lrycs by Henry Tyrrell '80, to the tune Tannenbaum. First published in the Cornell Era 1877.

B. F. Lent Publisher
Dedicated to Cornell's Athletes. Includes some text and the following songs: Alma Mater, Cornell, 1875: The Cornell Cheer, The Chimes, Alumni Song, Song Of The Classes, Rowing Song, Crew Song, Bustonian Chorus, Evening Song. (poor condition)

B. F. Lent Publisher
Dedicated to Cornell's Athletes. Includes some text and the following songs: Alma Mater, Cornell, 1875: The Cornell Cheer, The Chimes, Alumni Song, Song Of The Classes, Rowing Song, Crew Song, Bustonian Chorus, Evening Song, Smoking Song, Boating Song.

Includes various songs popular at colleges at the time, not Cornell specific. O Alma Mater, Aura Lee, Bavarian Yodel, Ching A Ling, Camptown Races, Emmett's Lullaby, Fill Up Your Stein, Forty Nine bottles, Go Down Moses, Good Night Ladies, Home Sweet Home, It's A Way We Have At Old Harvard, Lauriger Horatius, Little Brown Jug, A Little More Cider, My Meerschaum Pipe, Mary Had A Little Lamb, My Last Cigar, Mary And Martha, Old King Cole, Old Noah He Did Build An Ark, The Pope, Peter Gray, Rocked In The Cradle Of The Deep, Rio Grande, Swing Low Sweet Chariot, Tom Big Bee River, There Were Three Crows, Turn Back Pharoh's Army, There's Music In The Air, Three Little Pigs, Where Oh Where Is My Little Dog Gone, Where Oh Where, Where Are You Going My Pretty Maid.

B. F. Lent Publisher
Dedicated to Cornell's Athletes. Includes some text and the following songs: Alma Mater, Cornell, 1875: The Cornell Cheer, The Chimes, Alumni Song, Song Of The Classes, Rowing Song, Crew Song, Bustonian Chorus, Evening Song, Smoking Song, Boating Song, Football Song (Big Red Team).

B. F. Lent Publisher
Dedicated to Cornell's Athletes. Includes some text and the following songs: Alma Mater, Cornell, 1875: The Cornell Cheer, The Chimes, Alumni Song, Song Of The Classes, Rowing Song, Crew Song, Bustonian Chorus, Evening Song, Smoking Song, Boating Song, Football Song (Big Red Team).

Cover features Roberts and Stone Halls. Published by Hinds, Noble & Eldredge. Includes foreword by Liberty Hyde Bailey.
Includes Cornell Songs: All Round The World, Alma Mater, The Big Red Team or The Foot-Ball Song, Bustonian Chorus, The Call Of The Fields, Carnelian And White, The Chimes, Cornell, Dreaming, 1875: The Cornell Cheer, Evening Song, Fight For Cornell, Isle Of Delight, Locomotive Yell, The Old Farm At Cornell, Short Yell, The Song Of The Classes, Yells.
Songs of Other Colleges: Alma Mater – Amherst, Alma Mater – University of Chicago, Cheer For Old Amherst, Dear Old Yale, Fair Harvard, Hail, Pennsylvania!, Old Nassau, Orange And The Black, Our College Cheer, Sans Souci, We Stand By Our Classes, The Yellow And The Blue.
Humorous Songs: Broke! Broke! Broke!, The Bull-Dog, Change of the Short Ags, Doctor Peter Price’s Permanent Panacea, The Dutch Company, He Was Nervous, I Wish You’d Shave, Nut Brown Maiden, A Parody Song, Poor Ned, Where, O Where?.
Popular College Songs: Am I Not Fondly Thine Own?, Annie Laurie, Auld Lang Syne, Ben Bolt, A College Medley, Down In Mobile, Drinking Song, Drink To Me Only With Thine Eyes, Forsaken, Good-night, Ladies!, Here’s To The Girl That I Love, Home, Sweet Home, How Can I Leave Thee?, I Arise From The Dreams Of Thee, Jolly Boating Weather, Juanita, Last Night, Love’s Old Sweet Song, Maid Of Athens, Massa’s In De Cold Ground, My Bonnie, My Old Kentucky Home, Nelly Was A Lady, Old Folks At Home, The Old Oaken Bucket, Over The Banister, The Quilting Party, Romeo And Juliet, Soldier’s Farewell, Stars Of The Summer Night, Sweet And Low, Sweetheart, I Wait For Thee, Take My Love To Rosalie, There’s Music In The Aid, The Two Roses, WE Meet Again To-night.
Patriot And Sacred Songs: America, Battle Hymn of The Republic, Dixie;s Land, Jerusalem The Golden, John Brown’s Body, Lead, Kindly Light, The Marseillaise, Maryland!, My Maryland!, Old Black Joe, The Red White, and Blue, Russian Hymn, The Star-Spangled Banner, The Watch On The Rhine, We’re Tenting To-night.

B. F. Lent Publisher
Dedicated to Cornell's Athletes. Includes some text and the following songs: Alma Mater, Cornell, 1875: The Cornell Cheer, The Chimes, Alumni Song, Song Of The Classes, Rowing Song, Crew Song, Bustonian Chorus, Evening Song, Smoking Song, Boating Song, Big Red Team, Fight For Cornell, Carnelian And White.

Published and compiled by the Board of Editors at the authorization of the Agricultural Association of the New York State College of Agriculture at Cornell University. Published by Hinds, Noble, & Eldredge. Includes forward by Liberty Hyde Bailey.
Includes: All 'Round The World, Cornell, Alma Mater, Annie Laurie, Auld Lang Syne, The Big Red Team, Bingo, Blow Ye Winds, Heigh-ho!, Boating Song, Bring The Wagon Home, John, The Bull-Dog, Bustonian Chorus, Carnelian And White, The Chimes, Cornell, Crew Song, Dear Evelina, Sweet Evelina, Dear Old Pals, Dixie Land, Down In Mobile, Dreaming, Drink To Me Only With Thine Eyes, The Dutch Company, 1875-The Cornell Cheer, Evening Song, Fight For Cornell, Germany-Land, Give My Regards To Davy, Good-night, Ladies!, A Health To All Good Fellow, I Arise From Dreams Of Thee, Isle Of Delight, Jingle Bells, Juanita, Last Night, Levee Song, The Little Old Red Shaw, Long Live Our College, Love's Old Sweet Song, Meerschaum Pipe, The Mermaid, The Midshipmite, My Old Kentucky Home, Nelly Was A Lady, Noah, Old Black Joe, Old College Chum, Old Folks At Home, One, Two, Three, Four, On The Chapel Steps, Over The Banister, The Pope, The Poughkeepsie Races, The Quilting Party, Santa Lucia, Song Of The Classes, Spanish Cavalier, Stars Of A Summer Night, Sweet And Low, Sweetheart, I Wait For Thee, There's Music In The Air, Upon The College Campus, We Meet Again Tonight, We Stand By Our Classes, When First I Kissed Sweet Margaret, Where, Oh Where, Yells, Campus Song (University of Rochester, Cheer For Old Amherst, Down The Field (Yale), Fair Harvard, The Genesse (University of Rochester), Hail! Pennsylvania, Hamilton's Song, Oh! Syracuse, Old Nassau (Princeton), The Orange And The Black (Princeton), The Royal Purple (Williams), Sans Souci (Columbia), The Victors (Michigan), Yale Boola Song, The Yellow And Blue (Michigan).

Some different songs than the 1914 edition. Published and compiled by the Board of Editors at the authorization of the Agricultural Association of the New York State College of Agriculture at Cornell University. Published by Hinds, Noble, & Eldredge. Includes forward by Liberty Hyde Bailey.
Includes: All 'Round The World, Cornell, Alma Mater, Alumni Song, And When I Die, At Eight Upon The Hill, Auld Lang Syne, Australia, The Big Red Team or The Foot-Ball Song, Blow Ye Winds, Heigh-ho!, Boating Song, Bring The Wagon Home, John, Bustonian Chorus, By The Watermelon Vine, Lindy Lou, Carnelian And White, Carry Me Back To Old Virginny, Castle On The Nile, Cheer For The Team, The Chimes, Co-Eds' Chant, Cornell, Cornell Hymn, Cornellio, Cornell Yells, Crew Song, Dear Old Pals, Dixie's Land, Down By The Steam (Rebecca), Down In Mobile, Dreaming, Drink To Me Only With Thine Eyes, 1875-The Cornell Cheer, Eli, Evening Song, Everybody Works But Davy, Faculty, Fight For Cornell, Forty-Nine Bottles, Founder's Centenary Hymn, Founder's Hymn, Germany-Land, The Girls of Ithaca, Give My Regards To Davy, Glorious Mother-Cornell, Good-night, Ladies!, H-e-r-p-i-c-i-de, Honey, Dat I Love So Well, Isle Of Delight, Jingle Bells, Juanita, The King Of The Cannibal Islands, Last Night, Levee Song, The Little Old Red Shaw, The Midshipmite, Moon, Moon, My Old Kentucky Home, Old Black Joe, Old College Chum, Old Folks At Home, One, Two, Three, Four, On The Chapel Steps, The Poughkeepsie Races, Rocked In The Cradle Of The Deep, Rowing Song, Sage Maidens, Santa Lucia, Senior, Junior, Soph., Frosh., Soldier's Farewell, The Song Of The Classes, Spanish Cavalier, Stars Of A Summer Night, Sweetheart, I Wait For Thee, Tell Me, Maiden, Upon The College Campus, Campus Song (University of Rochester, Cheer For Old Amherst, Down The Field (Yale), Fair Harvard, The Genesse (University of Rochester), Hail! Pennsylvania, Hamilton's Song, Oh! Syracuse, Old Nassau (Princeton), The Orange And The Black (Princeton), Our Director (Harvard), The Princeton Cannon Song March, The Royal Purple (Williams), Yale Boola Song, The Yellow And Blue (Michigan).

Slightly different publisher than the other 1915 edition. Published and compiled by the Board of Editors at the authorization of the Agricultural Association of the New York State College of Agriculture at Cornell University. Published by Hinds, Hayden, & Eldredge. Includes forward by Liberty Hyde Bailey.
Includes: All 'Round The World, Cornell, Alma Mater, Alumni Song, And When I Die, At Eight Upon The Hill, Auld Lang Syne, Australia, The Big Red Team or The Foot-Ball Song, Blow Ye Winds, Heigh-ho!, Boating Song, Bring The Wagon Home, John, Bustonian Chorus, By The Watermelon Vine, Lindy Lou, Carnelian And White, Carry Me Back To Old Virginny, Castle On The Nile, Cheer For The Team, The Chimes, Co-Eds' Chant, Cornell, Cornell Hymn, Cornellio, Cornell Yells, Crew Song, Dear Old Pals, Dixie's Land, Down By The Steam (Rebecca), Down In Mobile, Dreaming, Drink To Me Only With Thine Eyes, 1875-The Cornell Cheer, Eli, Evening Song, Everybody Works But Davy, Faculty, Fight For Cornell, Forty-Nine Bottles, Founder's Centenary Hymn, Founder's Hymn, Germany-Land, The Girls of Ithaca, Give My Regards To Davy, Glorious Mother-Cornell, Good-night, Ladies!, H-e-r-p-i-c-i-de, Honey, Dat I Love So Well, Isle Of Delight, Jingle Bells, Juanita, The King Of The Cannibal Islands, Last Night, Levee Song, The Little Old Red Shaw, The Midshipmite, Moon, Moon, My Old Kentucky Home, Old Black Joe, Old College Chum, Old Folks At Home, One, Two, Three, Four, On The Chapel Steps, The Poughkeepsie Races, Rocked In The Cradle Of The Deep, Rowing Song, Sage Maidens, Santa Lucia, Senior, Junior, Soph., Frosh., Soldier's Farewell, The Song Of The Classes, Spanish Cavalier, Stars Of A Summer Night, Sweetheart, I Wait For Thee, Tell Me, Maiden, Upon The College Campus, Campus Song (University of Rochester, Cheer For Old Amherst, Down The Field (Yale), Fair Harvard, The Genesse (University of Rochester), Hail! Pennsylvania, Hamilton's Song, Oh! Syracuse, Old Nassau (Princeton), The Orange And The Black (Princeton), Our Director (Harvard), The Princeton Cannon Song March, The Royal Purple (Williams), Yale Boola Song, The Yellow And Blue (Michigan).

Compiled and Edited by Paul J. Weaver, published by the Cornell Alumni Association.
Includes: All 'Round the World, Cornell, Alma Mater, Alumnae Song, Alumni Song, The Big Red Team, Boating Song, Bustonian Chorus, Carneilian And White, The Chimes, Cornell, Cornell Changes (Jenny McGraw Rag) Cornell Hymn, Cornell Victorious, Crew Song, Dreaming, 1875, Evening Song, Everybody Works But Davy, Faculty, Fight For Cornell, Give My Regards To Davy, Hail Thou In Majesty, Cornell, The Hill, In The Red And The White, The Isle Of Delight, Lingering, Loyal Daughters Of Cornell, March On, Cornell, Tales Of Old Cornell, One, Two, Three, Four, The Poughkeepsie Course, In The Red And The White, Rowing Song, The Senior Dirge, Senior, Junior, Soph'more, Frosh, Song For Cornell, Song Of The Classes, Song Of The Classes (Women's Version), Tales of Old Cornell

Compiled and Edited by Paul J. Weaver, published by the Cornell Alumni Association.
Includes: All 'Round the World, Cornell, Alma Mater, Alumnae Song, Alumni Song, The Big Red Team, Boating Song, Bustonian Chorus, Carneilian And White, The Chimes, Cornell, Cornell Changes (Jenny McGraw Rag) Cornell Hymn, Cornell Victorious, Crew Song, Dreaming, 1875, Evening Song, Everybody Works But Davy, Faculty, Fight For Cornell, Give My Regards To Davy, Hail Thou In Majesty, Cornell, The Hill, In The Red And The White, The Isle Of Delight, Lingering, Loyal Daughters Of Cornell, March On, Cornell, Tales Of Old Cornell, One, Two, Three, Four, The Poughkeepsie Course, In The Red And The White, Rowing Song, The Senior Dirge, Senior, Junior, Soph'more, Frosh, Song For Cornell, Song Of The Classes, Song Of The Classes (Women's Version), Tales of Old Cornell

Compiled and Edited by Thomas A. Sokol. Published by the Cornell University Glee Club. Includes multiple voice part arrangements of the songs.
Includes: Alma Mater, Alumni Song, The Big Red Team, Carnelian And White, The Chimes, Cornell, Cornell Champions, Cornell Changes, Cornell Hymn, Cornell Victorious, Crew Song, 1875, Evening Song, Fight For Cornell, Gaudeamus Igitur, Give My Regards To Davy, Hail Thou In Majesty, Cornell, The Hill, In The Red And The White, March On, Cornell, My Old Cornell, New Cornell Fight Song, Song FOr Cornell, Song Of The Classes, Strike Up A Song To Cornell, Tales Of Old Cornell.
These contain lyrics only, no music. Song order and spellings are as they appear in the booklets.

did.physdesc: Brochure sized with red crest containing the title.

scopecontent.p: Includes: Alma Mater, Cornell, Evening Song, The Chimes, Alumni Song, Crew Song, Cornell Victorious, Poughkeepsie Course, Carnelian And White, Fight For Cornell, The Big, Red Team, Song Of The Classes, Here's To Old Cornell, I Want To BE A Mormon, Bustonian Chorus, Give My Regards To Davy, Levee Song, Noah, Push The Damper In, Dip Me In The Golden Sea, Honey, One, Two, Three, Four, I Had A Dream, Dear, That's Where My Money Goes, Ma Honey, Hindoostan, Newsy's Song, I'm A Little Prarie Flower, Ma Tildy Ann, The Pope, Landlord, Fill The Flowing Bowl, Li'l Liza Jane, 'Round Her Neck She Wears A Yeller Ribbon, Bring Back My Bonnie To Me, The Bull Dog, Little Pig, Caisson Song, Drunk Last Night, I Want To Be A Bar Keep, My CAttle On The Sunny River Nile, Pack Up Your Troubles In Your Old Kit Bag, Sweet Adeline, Goodnight, My Love, Good-night, Ladies.

did.unittitle: Cornell Songs as Sung by the Northeastern Ohio Cornell Association of Cleveland

scopecontent.p: Includes: Alma Mater, Evening Song, Cornell, The Chimes, The Cornell Cheer (1875, Alumni Song, Cornell Rowing Song, Here's To Old Cornell, CornellBoating Song, Kindling Wood, Crew Song, Big Red Team, Song Of The Classes, Carnelian And White.

did.unittitle: Cornell Songs as Sung by the Northeastern Ohio Cornell Association of Cleveland

scopecontent.p: Includes: Alma Mater, Evening Song, Cornell, The Chimes, The Cornell Cheer (1875, Alumni Song, Cornell Rowing Song, Here's To Old Cornell, CornellBoating Song, Kindling Wood, Crew Song, Big Red Team, Song Of The Classes, Carnelian And White, Bustonian Chorus, What You Going To Do?, Regards To Davy, Faculty, Everybody Works But Father, Stein Song, Australia!, Anheuser Bush, Stein Song (Prince of Pilsen), Landlord, Fill The Flowing Bowl, Am I The Boss?, Push The Damper In, Honey, Levee Song.

did.unittitle: Cornell Songs, Twenty-Third Annual Dinner of Cornell Alumni in New York City and Vicinity

scopecontent.p: Includes: Alma Mater, Cornell, The Chimes, 1875, Alumni Song, Song Of The Classes, Crew Song, Rowing Song, Bustonian Chorus, Cornell Evening Song, We Mett Again To-night, The Pope, Mermaid, There Is A Tavern In The Town, The Stein Song, Drinking-song, Give Us A Drink, I've Been Working On The LEvee, Bring The Wagon Home, Kindling-wood, In The evening By The Moonlight, Strolling, I Used To KNow A Little Yellow Girl, Far Away In The South.

Light tan cover. Published by the Corner Bookstores. Has photographs of the Corner Bookstore, Triangle Branch Store, and information about their products.
Includes: Alma Mater, Cornell, 1875: - The Cornell Cheer, The Chimes, Alumni Song, Song Of The Classes, Cornell Rowing Song, Crew Song, Bustonian Chorus, Cornell Boating Song, The Big Red Team, Evening Song.

Dark tan cover. Taylor & Company. Published by the Corner Bookstores. Has photographs of the Corner Bookstore, Triangle Branch Store, and information about their products.
Includes: Alma Mater, Cornell, 1875: - The Cornell Cheer, The Chimes, Alumni Song, Song Of The Classes, Cornell Rowing Song, Crew Song, Bustonian Chorus, Cornell Boating Song, The Big Red Team, Evening Song.

Compiled by L. And H. Published by Andrus & Church. Only Authorized Edition.
Includes: Alma Mater, The Broken Chord, Bonunkus, Bull-Dog, Cold Day When We Get Left, Chapeau, Cascadilla, The Chimes, Cornell Version, Cornell, Class Song '72, Class Song '73, Class Song '80, Class Song '83, Clementine, Cocachelunk, Children, Hail! Hail! Hail!, Crow Song, Drinking Song, Doloroso, Days In Bivouac, Down In Old Kentucky, Evening Song At Cornell, Eighty-Three Song, Founder's Hymn, Fourteen Long Weeks In A Pris-i-on, The Girls Of Ithaca, Good Old Cornell Times, Gospel Train Am Coming, The Hour Is Late, Hard-Up, Hark I Hear A Voice, I Wish I Were Single Again, Junior Supper Song, Junior Exhibition, Keep Me From Sinking Down, King Of The Cannibal Islands, Litoria, Landlord, Fill Your Flowing Bowl, Moustache, Mermaid, My Little Dog, O'er Hill And Dale, Parting Song - Class Of '72, Rambling Rake Of Poverty, A Retrospect, Ruby Lips, Solomon, The Ship, Sage Maidens, Seventy-Five, Song Of The '83 Soph, Swing Low Sweet Chariot, Solomon Levi, Smoking Song, 'Tis A Way We Have At Cornell, There Thy Star Is Gleaming, Training Song, Two Little Co-eds, There's Music In The Air, When First We Saw The Major, The Way We Have At Cornell, Sir, The Winter, What Am The Song That I Do Sing, Ye Gallant Sophomore.

Compiled by L. And H. Published by Andrus & Church. Only Authorized Edition. Second Edition. Notes that the work would not have happened without the assistance of C. B. Mandeville '77, F. A. Lorber '88, W. C. Kerr '79.
Includes: Alma Mater, At Eight Upon The Hill, B. B. Club Song, B. & B., Bench And Board, Bonunkus, The Bold Fisherman, Boys Of The B&B, The Broken Chord, Bull-Dog, Cascadilla, Cayuga Boat Song, Chapeau, Children, Hail! Hail! Hail!, Ching Bum, The Chimes, Class Song '72, Class Song '73, Class Song '80, Class Song '83, Clementine, Cocachelunk, Cold Day When We Get Left, Cornell, Cornell's The Stuff, Crow Song, Days In Bivouac, Dip Me In The Golden Sea, Doloroso, Down In Old Kentucky, Drinking Song, Eighty-Three Song, Evening Song At Cornell, Friuja Club, Founder's Hymn, Fourteen Long Weeks In A Pris-i-on, The Girls Of Ithaca, Good Old Cornell Times, Gospel Train Am Coming, Hark, I Hear A Voice, Hard-Up, Hurrah, Hurrah, The Festival Hour Is Nigh, I Wish I Were Single Again, Jeremiah McGuire's Mare's Nest, Junior Exhibition, Junior Supper Song, Keep Me From Sinking Down, King Of The Cannibal Islands, Landlord, Fill Your Flowing Bowl, Leap Your Waltz Song, Litoria, Mary And Martha, Mermaid, Moustache, My Bonnie, My Little Dog, O'er Hill And Dale, Oh! Roger Ram, Once Was Enough For Me, Owl Song, Parting Song - Class Of '72, Rambling Rake Of Poverty, A Retrospect, Roll, Jordan, Roll, Ruby Lips, Sage Maidens, Seventy-Five, The Ship, Soldier's Farewell, Solomon, Solomon Levi, Song Of The '83 Sophomore, Smoking Song, Swing Low Sweet Chariot, Temptation, Tell Me Maiden, The Hour Is Late, There Thy Star Is Gleaming, There's Music In The Air, 'Tis A Way We Have At Cornell, Training Song, Two Little Co-eds, Upidee, Uralio, Way We Have At Cornell, Sir, We Are Camping To-Night, What Am The Song That I Do Sing, When First We Saw The Major, The Winter, Ye Gallant Sophomore.

Published by B. F. Lent.
Includes: Alma Mater, Cornell, 1875 - The Cornell Cheer, The Chimes, Alumni Song, Song Of The Classes, Cornell Rowing Song, Crew Song, Bustonian Chorus, Cornell Boating Song, Big Red Team, Evening Song.

Being an illustrated edition of Cornell songs. One copy is incomplete the other is printed on the back Annual dinner of the Cornell alumni association of Buffalo held at the Buffalo Club, February 21, 1901, the University will be represted by Professor H. Morese Stephens.
Includes: Alma Mater, Cornell The Chimes, 1875, Alumni Song, Marching Thro' Cornell, The Classes, Bustonian Chorus, The Evening Song.

Being a pocket edition of Cornell songs presented by the Ithaca merchants. Includes advertising for many local businesses.
Includes: Alma Mater, The Chimes, Cornell Rowing Song, Alumni Song, Cornell, Busted, The Classes, Evening Song.

To The Class of 1904. Includes advertising for many local businesses.
Includes: Alma Mater, The Chimes, Cornell Rowing Song, 1875, Cornell, Marching Thro' Cornell, The Classes, Bingo, Evening Song, Busted.

Published by B. F. Lent.
Includes: Alma Mater, Cornell, 1875 - The Cornell Cheer, The Chimes, Alumni Song, Song Of The Classes, Cornell Rowing Song, Crew Song, Bustonian Chorus, Cornell Boating Song, Big Red Team, Fight For Cornell, Carnelian And White, Evening Song.

did.unittitle: Songs of Cornell for Senior Singing 1914

scopecontent.p:
Edited by Anson L. Clark, Charles K. Bassett, and H. O. Underhill.
Includes: Alma Mater, Alumni Song, Auld Lang Syne, Boola, Boola, Bye, Baby, Bye, Bring The Wagon Home, John, Bustonian Chorus, Carnellian And White, Crew Song, Cornell, Castle On The Nile, Cornell Rowing Song, Carry Me Back To Ole Virginia, Dat's Where Ma Money goes, Down Mobile, Dip Me In The Golden Sea, Dear Old Pals, Eli, Eveleine, Evening Song, Good-Bye Summer, Good Night, My Love, Good Night, Ladies, Give My Regards To Davy, Honey, Herpicide, I'm On My Way To Mandalay, In The Candle Light, I Want To Be 'Way Down In Dixie, Just A Song At Twilight, Jolly Boating Weather, Lord Geoffry Amherst, Lindy, Mary Jones, Old Man Noah, Oh, Ma Honey, Poughkeepsie Course, Stein Song, Sweet Adeline, Song Of The Classes, Senior, Junior, Sophomore, Frosh, There's A Girl In The Heart Of Maryland, The Big Red Team, Tennessee Moon, The Cornell Cheer, The Mermaid, The Chimes, Working On The Railroad, You're My Baby.

Published by the Cornell Association of Class Secretaries. Contains information about the composers and dates of the songs.
Includes: Alma Mater (1872) - Archibald Croswell Weeks '72 abd Willmot Moses Smith '74, Cornell (1869) - George Kingsley Birge '72, The Cornell Man (1907) - Kenneth Lewis Roberts '08 the Cornell Masque, The Cornell Cheer (1875) - John De Witt Warner '72, The Chimes at Fair Cornell (1891) - Fred Wallace Card '92, The Chimes (January 15, 1869) - Judge Francis Miles Finch written at the request of Jennie McGraw, Smoking Song (1870) - Judge Francis Miles Finch, Evening Song (1877) - Henry Tyrrell '80, Founder's Hymn (January 11, 1875) - Judge Francis Miles Finch, Founder's Centenary Hymn (January 11, 1907) - Burt Green Wilder, Rowing Song (1899) - Edward Ansell McCreary '00, Boating Song (1900) - William Allison Fuller '02, Regatta Song (Unknown), Crew Song (1897) - Robert James Kellogg '91, Cayuga Boat Song (1884) - Charles Babcock, The Big Red Team (1902) - Romeyn Berry '04, Carnelian And White (1908) - Kenneth Lewis Roberts '08, Cheer For The Team (1914) - Charles William Curtis '88 Rochester Cornell Club, Fight For Cornell (1906) - Kenneth Lewis Roberts '08, The Girls Of Ithaca (1880) - Harley Quinn, Sage Maidens (1880) - Charles Baker Mandeville '77, Tell Me, Maiden (1884) - Henry Tyrrell '80, Bustonia Chorus (1898) - Roland Franklyn Andrews '00, Song Of The Classes (1888) - Frank Addison Abbott '90, Freshman Song - On The Heights Above Cayuga (1873) - Stephen Perry Sturges '76, Junior Song - Ye Gallant Sophomore (1872) - Charles Fletcher Allen '73, Military Drill - When First We Saw The Major (1871) - John Bunyan Potter '74, At Eight Upon The Hill (Unknown), Cornell Club (Unknown), Give My Regards To Davy (Unknown), Senior, Junior, Sophomore, Frosh (Unknown), Alumni Song (1892) - Louis Carl Ehle '90, Cornell Celebrations (Celebration) (1914) - John Little Moffat '73, Reunion Song (December 29, 1914 - Henry Pelouze deForest '84, Cornellio (1885) - Elias David Abinun de Lima '86 Bench and Board, Class of '72 Song - The Ship Of Cornell (1870) - Albert Osborne '72, Class of '73 Song - Thy Bright Star Is Gleaming (June 16, 1873) - Charles Fletcher Allen '73, Class of '78 Song - Cornell Hymn (1906) - Albert William Smith '78, Class of '80 Song, Cayuga's Clustered Hills (June 15, 1880) - Henry Tyrrell '80, Class of '84 Song - The Cornell Grenadiers (June 22, 1904) Henry Pelouze de Forest '84 Twenty-Year Reunion, Class of '88 Song - Farewell Cornell (June 17, 1908) - Albert Ellis Hoyt '88 Twenty-Year Reunion, Class of '94 Song - Commencement Twenty Years After (June 12, 1914) - Herbert Latham Fordbam '94 Twenty-Year Reunion, Class of '05 Song - Glorious Mother - Cornell (June 17, 1908) - Robert Paul Butler '05 Three-Year Reunion.

did.unittitle: Songs of Cornell for Senior Singing 1915

scopecontent.p:
Edited by Samuel H. Worrell. With introduction by Henry P. De Forest.
Includes: Alma Mater, Alumni Song, Auld Lang Syne, Back To The Carolina You Love, Boola, Boola, Bye, Baby, Bye, Bring The Wagon Home, John, Bustonian Chorus, Celebratin' Day In Tennessee, Carnellian And White, Chinatown, My Chinatown, Crew Song, Cornell, Castle On The Nile, Cornell Rowing Song, Carry Me Back To Ole Virginia, Dat's Where Ma Money goes, Down Mobile, Dip Me In The Golden Sea, Dear Old Pals, Eli, Eveleine, Evening Song, Good-Bye Summer, Good Night, My Love, Good Night, Ladies, Good Bye Girls, I'm Through, Give My Regards To Davy, Honey, I Had A Dream, It's A Long Way To Tipperary, Just A Song At Twilight, Jolly Boating Weather, Jane, Lord Geoffry Amherst, Lindy, Old Man Noah, Oh, Ma Honey, Poughkeepsie Course, Roll Them Bones, Stein Song, Song Of The Cities, Sweet Adeline, Song Of The Classes, Senior, Junior, Sophomore, Frosh, The Big Red Team, Tip Top Tipperary Mary, The Cornell Cheer, The Mermaid, The Chimes, Working On The Railroad, You Wore A Tulip.

did.unittitle: Songs of Cornell for Senior Singing 1916

scopecontent.p:
Edited by the Class of 1916.
Includes: America, Alma Mater, Alumni Song, Auld Lang Syne, America, I Love You, Are You From Dixie, Bustonian Chorus, Boola, Boola, Bye, Baby, Bye, Bill Bailey, Bring The Wagon Home, John, Beach AT Waikiki, Carnellian And White, Carry Me Back To Ole Virginia, Cornell Victorious, Crew Song, Cornell, Castle On The Nile, Don't Go Away And Leave Me, Down Mobile, Dat's Where Ma Money goes, Dip Me In The Golden Sea, Eveleine, Evening Song, Eli, Give My Regards To Davy, Georgia Moon, Good-Night, Ladies, Honey, Hail Michigan, Here's To Old Cornell, I Had A Dream, Just A Song At Twilight, Jolly Boating Weather, Jane, Lindy, Lord Geoffry Amherst, Loading Up The Mandy Lee, Molly Dear, Old Man Noah, Oh, Ma Honey, On Christian Soldiers, Poughkeepsie Course, Push The Damper In, Roll Them Bones, Song Of The Cities, Stein Song, Song Of The Classes, Sweet Adeline, Senior, Junior, Sophomore, Frosh, The Big Red Team, The Mermaid, The Rocky Road To Dublin, The Cornell Cheer, The Old Green River, Working On The Railroad.

Published for events at the celebrations June 19-22, 1919.
Includes: Alma Mater, Aloha Oe, Alumni Song, America, America The Beautiful, Annie Laurie, Auld Lang Syne, Battle Hym Of The Republic, Bring Back My Bonnie, Bostonian Chorus [sp], Carnelian And White, Caisson Song, Columbia, The Gem Of The Ocean, Come, Thou Almighty King, Cornell, Cornell Victorious, Cornell Will Shine Tonight, Crew Song, Dixie, Drink To Me Only With Thune Eyes, Eighteen Seventy-five, Evening Song, Faith Of Our Fathers, Fight For Cornell, Give My Regards To Davy, Good-night, Ladies, Good-night, My Love, Honey, How Firm A Foundation, I'm A Little Prairie Flower, I Need Thee Every Hour, I've Been Wukkin' On De Railroad, Jesus, Saviour, Pilot Me, Juanita, K-K-Katy, Keep The Home Fires Burning, Li'l Liza Jane, Lovely Evening, Love's Old Sweet Song, My Castle On The Sunny River Nile, My Moustache, Nearer, My God To Thee, Old Black Joe, Old Folks At Home, O God, Our Help In Ages Patt, Onward Christian Soldiers, Pack Up Your Troubles In Your Old Kit Bag, 'Round Her Neck She Wears A Yeller Ribbon, Row Your Boat, Semi-Centennial Song, Smiles, Song Of The Classes, Sweet Adeline, Sweet Genevieve, That Creole Gal O'Mine, That's Where My Money Goes, The Big, Red Team, The Bull-Dog, The Chimes, The Duke Of Yorkshire, The Little Brown Church, The Pope, The Quilting Party, The Sunshine Of Your Smile, The Star Spangled Banner, There's A Long, Long Trail, Till We Meet Again, Tulip And The Rose, We Meet Again Tonight, When I Survey The Wondrous Cross, When The Great Red Dawn Is Shining, Who Did?.

Published by the Women's Self-Government Association
Includes: Alma Mater - Cornell, Song for Cornell, Loyal Daughters of Cornell, Cornell Victorious, Cornell, Carnelian and White, Fight for Cornell, All Round the World Cornell, Give My Regards to "Davy", Crew Song, The Big Red Team, Alumni Song, The Poughkeepsie Races, I Want To Go Back, Evening Song, The Chimes, Song of the Classes (Men), Song of the Classes (For the Girls), Rowing Song, Bostonian Chorus, I Want To Go Back To The Old Days, Old Man Noah, Down in Mobile, Moon, Moon; The Spanish Cavalier, Some Folks Hop Up and Down, Doggone That Moon, Alone, Tee-Hee, Alone; Wings, Down By The Stream, Sail, Seniors, Sail; Castle on the Nile, Auld Lang Syne, I've Been Working on the Railroad, I Want a Bungalow, Carry Me Back to Old Virginny, Father Time, That's Where My Money Goes, I Wish I Wuz a Little Rock, Sweet Evelyn, Toasts, Dear old Pals

did.unittitle: Songs The '09 Class of Cornell Used to Sing and Still Do

scopecontent.p: Collected and printed for their fifty-fifth reunion.

Lion's Rock, 316 East 77th Street, New York, NY
Includes: Selections reproduced from Songs of Cornell 1988.

An Alumni Affairs publication sponsored by the Cornell Association of Class Officers.
Includes: Alma Mater, Alumni Song, The Big Red Team, Carnelian And White, Cornell, Cornell Hymn, Cornell Victorious, Crew Song, 1875, Evening Song, Fight For Cornell, Give My Regards To Davy, Hail Thou In Majesty, Cornell, The Hill, In The Red And The White, March On, Cornell, My Old Cornell, Song For Cornell, Song Of The Classes, Strike Up A Song To Cornell.

did.unittitle: Series IV. Miscellaneous Lyric Sheets and Music Related Items

scopecontent.p: Lyrics by Archibald C. Weeks '72.

No music, just lyrics. From a Tuesday night, November 27 rally at Bailey Hall.
Includes: The Big Red Team, Fight for Cornell, Carnelian and White, Cornell Victorious.

Includes: America, Our Empire State, Let The Rest Of The World Go By, Long, Long Trail, Auld Lang Syne, Swanee River, America The Beautiful, Sailing, The Mummy Song, Sweet Adeline, 'Till We Eat Again, Pack Up Your Troubles In Your Old Kit Bag, Levee Song, School Days, Smiles, The Old Grey Mare, 'Round Her Neck She Wears A Yeller Ribbon, Round: - When You Meet A Donkey, Jingle Bells, Battle Hymn Of The Republic, Yawnin In The Mawnin, We're Here For Fun, Our Boys Will Shine, The Old Apple Pipe, The Damper Song, Carry Me Back To Old Virginny, Down In De Cornfield, Annie Laurie, Maggie, Dunderback, There Ain't No Flies On Us, In The Good Old Summer Time, The More We Are Together, Pussy Willow Song, Old MacDonald Had A Far, Our Cow, Style All The While, Chew-Chew, Paving, Moonlight And Roses.

Appears to be published by the Cornell Glee Club. No music, just lyrics.
Includes: The Chimes, Cornell, Alma Mater, The Winter, Hark; I Hear A Voice, I love My Love, Moustache, The Old Cabin Home, Smoking Song, Bingo, All Together, Landlord, Fill Your Flowing Bowl, Solomon Levi, Rumsty Ho!, What Am The Song What I Do Sing, Hard Up.

No music, just lyrics.
Also includes: There's Music In The Air, Landlord, Fill Your Flowing Bowl, 'Twas Oft The Blue Canaries, I've A Jolly Sixpence, 'Tis A Way We Have At Cornell, Cornell

Various pieces all titled Cornell Songs, none have music, just lyrics.
Songs include: Alma Mater, Cornell, Don't Send My Boy to Harvard, The Red and the White, Song for Cornell, Song of the Classes, Song of the Classes (Women's Version), Fight for Cornell, Senior Dirge, Cornell Victorious, Give My Regards to Davy, Carnelian and White, Alumni Song, Evening Song, Crew Song, Reunion Song (Women), Loyal Daughters of Cornell, Bustonian Chorus, Poughkeepsie Course,, Eli, March on Cornell!, Whiffenpoof Song, Lord Geoggrey Amherst, Keep the Home Fires Burning, There's a Long Long Trail A'winding, Chiming Bells, The Chimes, In Bohemia Hall, On the Road to Mandalay, Dink a High Ball, Eveline, When You Wore a Tulip, Abdulla Bulbul Ameer, There is a Tavern in the Town, Mandy Lee, Love's Old Sweet Song, Missouri Waltz, Sweet and Low, Steal Away, Nobody Knows, Swing Low! Sweet Chariot!, Old Black Joe, Beside a Belgian Waterfall, Clementine, The Titanic, Silver Dollar, Pack Up Your Troubles in Your Old Kit Bag, Juanita, Smiles, My Wild Irish Rose, Jacob's Ladder, Jeanie With The Light Brown Hair, Alexander's Ragtime Band, Anchors Aweigh, The Caisson Song, The Marines' Hymn, Army Air Corps Song, It's A Long Way To Tipperary, Over There, I Lost My Heart To A Beta, Shortnin' Bread, Oh Susanna, The Man On The Flying Trapeze, Stein Song, Far Away In The South, The Pope, Mermaid, O, Bring The Wagon, Home, John, Good Night, My Love, Auld Lang Syne, 1875, The Chimes, Kindling-wood, Drinking-song, In The Evening By The Moonlight, I Used To Know A Little Yellow Girl, I've Benn Working On The Levee, Bring the Wagon Home, We Meet Again To-night.
Includes: Long, Short, Locomotive, Marching Or Double, Siren
Poem about Sage Chapel.
No composer listed.

did.unittitle: Page 3 and 4 of a song sheet

scopecontent.p: Includes: All Round The World, Cornell and Alumni Song.

did.unittitle: Songs For The Senior Informal Smokers And Senior Singing

scopecontent.p:
Published by the Lehigh Valley Railroad.
Includes: Cornell, Evening Song, Stop, Stop, Stop, By The Light Of The Silvery Moon, Moonlight In Jungle Land, Mary Jones, Bring The Wagon Home John, Come Josephine In My Flying Machine, Song Of The Classes, The Big Red Team, Alma Mater, Cornell Rowing Song, Kiss Me, Down In Louisiana, Top Of The Morning To You, For I Love It, Put Your Arms Around Me, Honey, Crew Song, Come Be My Lindy Jane.
Hymns sung at the June 13, 1875 opening of the chapel.
Includes: Cornell, song to the Air Dearest Mae, Bull Dog, Smoking Song, Alma Mater, Here's To Old Cornell, Parting Ode by Robert H. Treman, sung to Auld Lang Syne.
Lyrics by William Nelson Smith '90. No music, just lyrics. Dedicated to Sophomores in General and Engineers in Particular.
Probably a song book for the Class of 1891. No music, just lyrics. Includes Class Song, Vive 'L Amour, The Pope, Rosalie, Jingle Bells, Solomon Levi, The Chimes, The Owl and the Pussy-Cat, Alma Mater

By Susan E. Linn Sage.
Published after being found in her papers after her death in 1885. reverse has note "Presented to E. F. Curtis by Miss Linn, October 1898.
Includes: America, Cornell, Evening Song, The Chimes, Cornell Rowing Song, Alma Mater.

Includes: Alma Mater, Smoking Song by Judge F. M. Finch, Evening Song, sung to the air Maryland, Cornell, sung to the air Dearest Mae, The Chimes, sung to the air Tramp, Tramp, Tramp, Cornell Rowing Song, America.
Includes: Alma Mater, Smoking song by Judge F. M. Finch, Evening Song, Cornell, The Chimes, Cornell Rowing Song, America

did.unittitle: Founder's Centenary Hymn in honor of Ezra Cornell, 1807 - January 11 - 1907

scopecontent.p:
Composed by Burt G. Wilder.
Second (Alumni) Edition produced by the Cornell -Co-operative society.
No music, lyrics only, on a small card. Arhur H. Crist '90 publisher. Sung to the air I Want To Go Back To Michigan.
Lyrics by Albert William Smith '78. Music by James T. Quarles.
Cornell Daily Sun article explaining the origins of the song composed by Roland Franklin Andrews '00.

Lyrics by John D. Guthrie '39. Sung to the air Home on the Range.
From a Cornell Forestry student.
Music sheets for many instruments in the band. Songs include: Alma Mater, March On Cornell, Cornell Victorious, Carnelian And White, Fight For Cornell, The Big Red Team, Evening Song.

Article and reprint of article by Romeyn Berry discussing the proper way to sing the Zinck's line in Give My Regards to Davy. Also includes information about the Glee Club drinking at Zinck's and other stories about the bar and bar owner.
Music sheets for many instruments in the band.
Music sheets for many instruments in the band.
Includes various instrument parts for the songs Big Red Team, Cornell Victorious, Fight For Cornell, March On, My Old Cornell
